page.title: 04Herds, animal breeds,stables
page.content: Only about 5 of the farms in the area keep milking cows (about 500 in all), with between 300 and 400 followers. The predominant breed is Friesian, although one farm has Guernseys. About four farms keep sheep (mainly the Suffolk breed), and the flocks average around 400 in number. For beef cattle, the major breeds kept are Hereford and Friesian, but there is also one herd of Limousin. Only two farms keep hens : one of these also has some Muscovey ducks (for meat), the other also has 500 turkeys. About 20 goats are kept by another farmer who sells the goats' milk. Five farms keep horses for pleasure, although one uses the horses for farmwork. Three of these five farms also breed horses. Millaway Farm which used to have a riding school, is a farm as well as Livery Stables.
